title: John Wood (footballer, born 1884)
text:
John W. Wood (1884–1959) was an <a href="English%20people">English</a> <a href="association%20football">association football</a> player, referee and coach who was briefly head coach of the <a href="United%20States%20men%27s%20national%20soccer%20team">United States men's national soccer team</a>. He was born in <a href="Nottingham">Nottingham</a>, England. Upon emigrating to the US, Wood played for several teams on the <a href="East%20Coast%20of%20the%20United%20States">east coast</a>. He later became the soccer coach at <a href="Oak%20Park%20and%20River%20Forest%20High%20School">Oak Park High School</a> in <a href="Oak%20Park%2C%20Illinois">Oak Park</a>, <a href="Illinois">Illinois</a>.
Wood led the American team at the <a href="1952%20Summer%20Olympics">1952 Summer Olympics</a>, and was inducted into the <a href="National%20Soccer%20Hall%20of%20Fame">National Soccer Hall of Fame</a> that same year. Former head coach <a href="Walter%20Giesler">Walter Giesler</a> served as manager for the 1952 squad. The team played one game at those games, losing a qualifier to <a href="Italy%20national%20football%20team">Italy</a> 8–0.
